business.headline: Inside India's insurance mis-selling problem and why it remains hard to fixInsurance mis-selling remains widespread even under regulatory watch. So why does it continue slipping past rules, checks, and repeated warnings? Read on to understand why.

Amazon Pay launches fixed deposit service with returns of up to 8%. Check detailsAmazon Pay users can now do more than just pay bills and shop online. The company has launched a fixed deposit service that lets customers invest in FDs through the app, with returns going up to 8%.

Explained: Why Venezuela's stock market jumped 50% in a day after the US attackThe benchmark Venezuela IBC Index, which tracks shares traded in Caracas (capital of Venezuela), surged 50% in a single session on Tuesday.

Titan share price up 4%: Why is the Jhunjhunwala stock rising today?The stock opened higher at Rs 4,200.45 compared with the previous close of Rs 4,111.10. During the session, it touched an intraday high of Rs 4282.00 and a low of Rs 4,200.45. The volume-weighted average price stood at Rs 4,254.78.
Sensex opens 184 points lower, Nifty below 26,150; Titan up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 255.21 points to 84,808.13, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 72.90 points to 26,105.80 as of 9:47 am.

Gold and silver rates today: Buy, wait or sell?Gold prices in India were largely steady on January 7, 2026, with only a marginal rise seen across purity levels. As per the latest data, 24K gold was priced at Rs 13,883 per gram, up by Rs 1.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO to open soon: Latest GMP update for investorsThe price band for the IPO of Bharat Coking Coal has been fixed at Rs 21 to Rs 23 per share. The lot size is 600 shares. Based on the upper price band, a retail investor will need to invest at least Rs 13,800 for one lot.

Reliance sees worst session since June 2024. What should investors do now?Reliance Industries shares closed 4.5% lower at Rs 1,507.6, marking their steepest decline since June 4, 2024. During the session, the stock slipped as much as 5.1% to Rs 1,496.30, hitting its lowest level since November 11, as selling pressure intensified.
Sensex ends 376 points lower, Nifty below 26,200; RIL tanks 4%The S&P BSE Sensex declined 376.28 points to close at 85,063.34, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 71.60 points to end at 26,178.70.

Tata Steel, JSW Steel and SAIL found in breach of antitrust laws: ReportThe Competition Commission of India has also held 56 top executives liable for price collusion over different periods between 2015 and 2023.

Why US–Venezuela tensions have global markets watching oil and goldTensions between the US and Venezuela are worrying markets because oil supplies and economic stability could be affected if the situation worsens. Here's all you need to know.

Reliance share price crashes 5%: Is it good time to buy the stock?RIL share price: The stock opened slightly lower at Rs 1,575.55 and remained under selling pressure through the session. At the time of writing, the share price was at Rs 1,509, down Rs 68.45 or 4.34%.

Is Venezuela the trigger, or is gold and silver's rally bigger than geopolitics?In India, MCX gold is trading at a lifetime high. A decisive breakout could push prices sharply higher, while lower levels continue to attract buyers rather than panic sellers. MCX silver, trading over Rs 2.5 lakh, remains in an uptrend as long as key support zones hold.

Cupid share price rebounds sharply, up 9% today. Here's whyThe rebound follows a brutal sell-off on Monday, when the stock plunged nearly 20% after a large block deal weighed on sentiment and triggered aggressive profit-booking.

HDFC Bank share price falls over 2% after Q3 business updateHDFC Bank shares were among the top drags on benchmark indices as selling pressure intensified, even as the broader market traded lower in early deals.

Reliance share price down over 4%. Why is it falling today?The fall in Reliance shares comes against the backdrop of a broader market correction. Both the Sensex and the Nifty traded lower in early deals as investors turned cautious on global cues and reduced exposure to heavyweight stocks.

Trent shares fall 8%: Why is the stock falling today, and should you buy?Trent share price: The stock opened lower at Rs 4,219.90 and slipped further to an intraday low of Rs 4,060.65, close to its 52-week low of Rs 3,931.45.
Sensex opens 150 points lower, Nifty below 26,300; RIL down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 238.67 points to 85,200.95, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 57.15 points to 26,193.15 as of 9:22 am.

Reliance Industries denies report on Russian oil deliveries to Jamnagar refineryReliance clarified that its Jamnagar refinery has not received any cargo of Russian oil in the past three weeks. The company also said it is not expecting any deliveries of Russian crude oil in January.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO: Price band out, does GMP point to 50% listing gains?Bharat Coking Coal IPO is a book-built issue of Rs 1,071.11 crore. The entire issue is an offer for sale of 46.57 crore shares, with no fresh issue component.

entertainment.headline: Taapsee Pannu on career setbacks: Flops and heartbreaks shaped my choices Taapsee Pannu shared that a phase of flops and heartbreaks early in her career helped her find her true calling as an actor.

Akhanda 2 OTT release: When and where to watch Nandamuri Balakrishna's film Director Boyapati Sreenu's fantasy-action-thriller 'Akhanda 2: Thaandavam' is all set for its OTT release. The film featuring Nandamuri Balakrishna was released on December 12, 2025.
Shraddha Kapoor has a playful reply to fan curious about her marriage plans Shraddha Kapoor's playful reply to a fan's marriage question went viral amid reports of her relationship with Rahul Mody.

Sydney Sweeney's The Housemaid sequel confirmed. Check details here Lionsgate has announced a sequel to the psychological thriller The Housemaid, titled The Housemaid's Secret. The new instalment will continue Millie's story, with key cast members returning and filming set to begin later this year.

Jana Nayagan vs Parasakthi: 2 days left, no censor clearance, TVK-DMK clash deepens Vijay's Jana Nayagan and Sivakarthikeyan's Parasakthi face unprecedented censor delays with just 2 days to go for their big Pongal release. The hold-up reveals deep political tensions between TVK and DMK ahead of Tamil Nadu elections.

Bare-bodied Hrithik Roshan serves 25 seconds of pure Greek God energy. Watch Hrithik Roshan drops a 25-second shirtless video that sets the internet on fire, reminding fans why he's called India's Greek God. From sculpted abs to devilish vibes, the clip has social media in meltdown.

Legendary Hungarian filmmaker Béla Tarr, pioneer of slow-moving cinema, dies at 70 Hungarian filmmaker Bela Tarr has died at the age of 70 after a prolonged illness. His distinctive style and collaborations left a profound mark on global arthouse cinema.

Samantha is ready for action in Maa Inti Bangaaram. First look poster out Samantha Ruth Prabhu's intense new poster hints at a quirky, action-led Telugu film, with the actor performing her own stunts in Maa Inti Bangaaram. The film, directed by Nandini Reddy, is created by her husband and filmmaker, Raj Nidimoru.

I am not pizza: Shefali Shah recalls leaving her first marriage for self-worth Shefali Shah opened up about the difficult phase following her first marriage, revealing how choosing to live alone helped her rediscover self-worth and independence.

MasterChef India: Double amputee Nepali chef wins hearts with grit. Watch Ratna Tamang, a double amputee chef from Nepal, captured attention on MasterChef India Season 10. The promo featuring Tamang has gone viral.

Dhurandhar box office Day 33: Earns Rs 1222 crore globally, beats RRR in the US Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar' has become a global box office phenomenon, earning Rs 1222 crore in 33 days and surpassing major Indian blockbusters in the US. The Ranveer Singh-starrer is now on track to overtake 'RRR's' lifetime collection.

Ikkis box office Day 6: Agastya Nanda's film gets bigger Tuesday than Monday Ikkis, starring Agastya Nanda, has wrapped up its first six days at the Indian box office with Rs 23 crore nett. The Sriram Raghavan directorial has shown stable weekday collections amid a clear theatrical window.

Ikkis choreographer recalls Dharmendra dancing despite discomfort: It was difficult Choreographer Vijay Ganguly recalled a moving moment from Dharmendra's final film Ikkis, revealing how the veteran actor insisted on dancing despite physical difficulty during a late-night shoot.

Neena Gupta reveals fiance ditched her before wedding, proposed again months later Actor Neena Gupta discusses her engagement being called off days before the wedding and the lack of explanation she received, highlighting how the experience shaped her subsequent life and decisions.

Seven Dials trailer: Netflix reimagines Agatha Christie classic for new generation The trailer for the upcoming adaptation of Agatha Christie's Seven Dials introduces audiences to Lady Eileen 'Bundle' Brent, as she investigates a murder mystery set in the 1920s, highlighting both the intrigue of the original story and a modern approach to the character.

Daisy Shah slams reckless election campaigners after fire breaks out near her home Actor Daisy Shah has expressed her shock and anger after a house in Mumbai's Bandra East area was reportedly set ablaze, allegedly due to crackers being burst as part of an election campaign.

Single Papa: Netflix renews Kunal Kemmu's comedy-drama for Season 2 The widely acclaimed series 'Single Papa', starring Kunal Kemmu, will return to Netflix for a second season following strong audience reception and its appearance in the Global Top 10 Non-English TV Shows.

Kei Ishikawa on adapting Kazuo Ishiguro's A Pale View of Hills for screen. Exclusive Japanese filmmaker Kei Ishikawa's A Pale View of Hills explores the theme of mother-daughter relationship that transcends cultural borders. Ishikawa spoke to India Today about the film, based on Kazuo Ishiguro's novel of the same name.

Nick Jonas can't get Priyanka-Sunil Grover's trending track out of his head. Watch Nick Jonas shared a video on Instagram grooving to Priyanka Chopra and Sunil Grover's viral song from The Great Indian Kapil Show. Fans reacted enthusiastically to the couple's playful interaction.

general news.headline: PM Modi said to me, 'Sir, may I see you, please?': Trump's latestUS President Donald Trump claimed that Narendra Modi personally approached him over long-pending Apache helicopter deliveries and trade issues, while acknowledging a strong personal rapport.

Live: Petitioner cites 90-year-old victim, counsel warns against mass impounding of dogsSC Hearing Live Updates: The Supreme Court began hearing the stray dogs and cattle case, with a three-judge bench flagging serious safety concerns over stray animals on highways. Questioning poor compliance by states and NHAI, the court cited recent accidents involving judges and sought clarity on barricading roads and sheltering cattle. Stay with IndiaToday.in for latest and live updates-
5 arrested for violence during Delhi demolition drive, conspiracy angle being probed5 arrested after demolition drive near Delhi mosque turns violent, conspiracy angle being probed

I fear Iran is next, US fights wars that Israel tells it to fight: Jeffrey SachsRenowned economist Jeffrey Sachs warns that Iran could be Trump's next target after Venezuela, calling the US a "rogue state" with no constitutional order. He reveals decades of regime change operations and predicts a potential global explosion if Trump follows through on threats against Tehran.

Trump drops the pretence: Venezuela and Greenland are all about oil, mineralsHandcrafted ByOur Editors After Iraq, as the US carried out another invasion, capturing Venezuelan president Nicolas Maduro, Trump has been brazen and unabashed about his motive. It's all about Venezuela's oil and its minerals. The two other countries he has threatened -- Greenland and Colombia -- have large deposits of rare earths and minerals.
Don't chickens, goats have lives?: Supreme Court on stray dog lovers' pleaDon't chickens and goats have lives? Supreme Court on dog lovers' plea against removal of strays

A BJP-Congress alliance? Yes, the unthinkable has actually happenedIn an unusual political development, the BJP and Congress have joined forces in Maharashtra's Ambernath Municipal Council, drawing sharp criticism from the Shiv Sena, which called the alliance "unholy".

Did drugs flow into US from Maduro's Venezuela? This is what data revealsUS President Donald Trump said that Venezuelan leader Nicholas Maduro was arrested on charges of drug trafficking and narco-terrorism against Americans. However, a look at available data says that the cocaine produced in Venezuela is mostly pushed into Europe. The vast majority of cocaine and synthetic drugs in the US come from Mexico and Colombia.

UP women steal gold jewellery worth Rs 14 lakh in 14 minutes from store. Watch videoThe women entered the showroom posing as customers interested in buying jewellery. While a salesman was busy showing them various items, one of the women discreetly picked up a display pad containing gold earrings.

Dropped from Bangladesh Premier League? Indian sports presenter clarifies exitIndian sports presenter Ridhima Pathak has clarified her exit from the Bangladesh Premier League, affirming her decision was voluntary amid ongoing India-Bangladesh cricket tensions. Bangladesh banned the broadcast of the IPL 2026 in the country after Mustafizur Rahman's contract was terminated by the BCCI.

5 detained as Delhi demolition drive turns violent, cops use tear gas on protestersTensions flared briefly in Old Delhi's Turkman Gate when people tried to breach barricades and threw stones at police during a pre-dawn demolition drive to clear encroachments near a mosque. Police responded by firing tear gas, dispersing the crowd and restoring order.

ICC rejects Bangladesh's request to move T20 World Cup matches out of IndiaThe ICC has turned down Bangladesh's request to move T20 World Cup matches out of India, sources tell India Today. The decision deepens tensions after Mustafizur Rahman's IPL exit and security concerns raised by BCB.

This roadside stop became famous for just one dishThere's a certain stretch in West Bengal where both sides of the road line up with sweet shops stacked back-to-back, each promising the same thing: Langcha. This is Shaktigarh, or what most travellers now simply recognise as the place to stop for this delectable sweet.

Michael Schumacher dies, but not the F1 legend. Social media gets it wrongUS author Michael Schumacher passed away at age 75, triggering social media confusion. Several mistakenly mourned the F1 legend sharing the same name.

Karnataka BJP woman leader alleges stripping, assault by police during arrestA BJP woman leader in Karnataka's Hubballi was allegedly assaulted by police during her arrest, with videos circulating online. Police denied the allegations, citing resistance and multiple cases against her.

Message to Anushka? Fans spot Virat Kohli's special cardigan at Mumbai airportVirat Kohli made a notable arrival at Mumbai airport on Tuesday evening, wearing a distinctive cardigan that sparked discussion among fans. Kohli will join the Indian ODI squad in Vadodara, which will host the ODI series opener against New Zealand on January 11.

Isro's PSLV-C62 to launch India's first satellite refueling missionAayulSAT aims to extend satellite lifespans by enabling refuelling and servicing in orbit, addressing space debris and sustainability challenges.

After 24-day battle, AIIMS Bhopal doctor dies of alleged anaesthesia overdoseAccording to police, Dr Verma had returned home after completing her duty on December 11, when she allegedly administered herself a high dose of anaesthesia. She died on Monday after battling for life for 24 days.

This 140-year-old German study technique can help CBSE students remember betterSpaced repetition helps CBSE students retain concepts with timely revisions. This German technique reduces exam stress and boosts confidence through smarter study routines.

Elon Musk explains how tiny human civilisation is on the cosmic scaleElon Musk talks humanity's slow progress toward harnessing cosmic-scale energy and urges ambitious benchmarks for future advancements.
Video: Snow burns as fiery lava from Mt Etna volcano eruption flowsThe volcano located in Sicily, Italy, is one of the most active volcanoes in the world and the most active in Europe.

Anti-India leader Osman Hadi's murder planned in Singapore, politically motivatedBangladesh police said student leader Sharif Osman Hadi's murder was a case of political vengeance, with the conspiracy allegedly planned in Singapore.

Gurugram woman refuses to pay after marathon cab ride, threatens molestation caseA woman in Gurugram allegedly scammed a cab driver by refusing to pay after a long ride and threatened him with police action. The police have registered an FIR and are investigating her fraudulent activities.

Anti-PM slogans bring JNU back in national limelight: Here's what happenedJawaharlal Nehru University came under scrutiny after alleged slogans against Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah were raised during a campus protest, prompting administrative action and a police probe.

sports.headline: Tears in the stands as Jacob Bethell hits maiden Test hundred in Sydney Ashes 2025-26: Jacob Bethell's father was moved to tears after his 22-year-old son hit his maiden Test hundred in Sydney on Wednesday. Bethell remained unbeaten on 142 as England went to Stumps on Day 4 of the fifth Test with a 119-run lead and two wickets in hand.

Jemimah Rodrigues faces stern test of acing huge Delhi Capitals captaincy challenge WPL 2026: Jemimah Rodrigues will lead Delhi Capitals for the first time, but she has prior experience of captaining at the domestic level. The youngster has a big task ahead, replacing the legendary Meg Lanning at the Delhi Capitals.

Neymar lives Batman dream with million-dollar Batmobile, Batcopter and jet flex Neymar has fulfilled a childhood dream by adding a Batmobile to his collection. Parked beside his Batcopter and private jet, the purchase underlines the Brazilian star's flair for the extraordinary off the pitch.

Bangladesh deny claims of ICC ultimatum over not playing T20 World Cup in India The Bangladesh Cricket Board on Wednesday firmly rejected media reports suggesting it had received an ultimatum from the International Cricket Council regarding Bangladesh's participation in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026, set to be hosted in India.

Dropped from Bangladesh Premier League? Indian sports presenter clarifies exit Indian sports presenter Ridhima Pathak has clarified her exit from the Bangladesh Premier League, affirming her decision was voluntary amid ongoing India-Bangladesh cricket tensions. Bangladesh banned the broadcast of the IPL 2026 in the country after Mustafizur Rahman's contract was terminated by the BCCI.

Are clubs paying to play ISL? How AIFF is making Indian football cry ISL's return masks deeper trouble as clubs are forced to fund the league themselves. Pay cuts, player exits and rushed decisions show Indian football's problems did not end with confirming the 2025–26 season.

Message to Anushka? Fans spot Virat Kohli's special cardigan at Mumbai airport Virat Kohli made a notable arrival at Mumbai airport on Tuesday evening, wearing a distinctive cardigan that sparked discussion among fans. Kohli will join the Indian ODI squad in Vadodara, which will host the ODI series opener against New Zealand on January 11.

Was India's historic 2018-19 Test series win in Australia overrated? January 7 marks the 7th anniversary of India's historic Test series win in Australia. Today we revisit India's landmark 2018–19 series, and the debate – whether it was overrated?

Ashes: Ben Stokes injured in Sydney as England's tour goes from bad to worse England's Ashes misery deepened in Sydney after Ben Stokes limped off injured on Day 4. The captain's groin problem added to England's growing list of concerns in a tour slipping further away.

With LA 28 qualification in sight, can India move on from Manpreet Singh? As India chase Asian Games gold and LA Olympics qualification, Manpreet Singh's fitness, experience and versatility remain irreplaceable. But with his future now under cloud, can Indian hockey afford to move on from their veteran dynamic midfielder?

ICC rejects Bangladesh's request to move T20 World Cup matches out of India The ICC has turned down Bangladesh's request to move T20 World Cup matches out of India, sources tell India Today. The decision deepens tensions after Mustafizur Rahman's IPL exit and security concerns raised by BCB.

Lionel Messi gets candid in fun interview, opens up on AI use and being 'weird'Lionel Messi peeled back the layers in a rare, fun-filled interview, speaking openly about solitude, routines and modern technology. From AI to social media, the football icon showed a refreshingly human side.

Malaysia Open live score: PV Sindhu wins opening round in straight gamesMalaysia Open 2026 live score and updates: PV Sindhu has made a winning start to the 2026 season. The World No. 18 beats Sung Shuao Yun of Chinese Taipei in straight games to move into the second round of the Super 1000 tournament. Earlier on Tuesday, Lakshya Sen and Ayush Shetty won their first round in men's singles.

After IPL exit, Bangladesh's Mustafizur Rahman joins Pakistan Super LeagueMustafizur Rahman has joined the Pakistan Super League shortly after being released from the IPL. The Bangladesh pacer's move follows KKR's decision to end his contract amid tensed cross-country relations.

New Zealand announce spin-heavy T20 World Cup squad, include in-form RCB pacerNew Zealand named a spin-focused T20 World Cup squad built for Indian conditions and experience ahead of tournament. In-form pacer Jacob Duffy headlines selection after record-breaking year and maiden global tournament call-up with deserved reward.

Glenn Phillips turns left-handed: Is this NZ's secret plan for World Cup?New Zealand's Glenn Phillips is a unique player. He bats, bowls, keeps and is an incredible fielder on the boundary rope. Right-hander Phillips seems to have added one more weapon in his arsenal, batting left-handed.

Historic 1st as SG Pipers opt to field 9 Indian stars in Women's Hockey India LeagueIn a historic first in the Women's Hockey India League, the SG Pipers named nine Indian players in their starting XI for the clash against Shrachi Bengal Tigers on Tuesday, January 6. The Pipers went down fighting in the game in a sudden-death shootout.

After IPL snub, Mustafizur Rahman unfazed by India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup sagaAfter his controversial IPL snub, Mustafizur Rahman appears to be unfazed by all the noise surrounding the India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup row. Bangladesh have refused to send their team to India for the upcoming ICC event.

No need for split coaching in Indian cricket at the moment: HarbhajanFormer India cricketer Harbhajan Singh does not want split coaching in the Indian team. Harbhajan has backed Gautam Gambhir as questions continue to loom about his red-ball credentials.

Ole back at Manchester United? Solskjaer seen in amidst return rumoursAmist Manchester United return rumours, Ole Gunnar Solksjaer was spotted in Cheshire on Tuesday, January 6. Solksjaer is considered to be United's top target for the interim manager role until the end of the season.

Controversial spinner Lamichhane headlines Nepal's 15-member T20 World Cup squadSandeep Lamichhane will be spearheading Nepal's spin attack as they reveal the 15-member squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026 on Tuesday, January 6. Rohit Paudel will be leading the side with Dipendra Airee acting as his deputy.

ICC unmoved, set to request Bangladesh to play T20 World Cup in India: ReportThe International Cricket Council wants Bangladesh to play its group-stage matches in India. The international body was expected to host a meeting with the Bangladesh Cricket Board on Tuesday.

Pep Guardiola makes Manchester United claim after Amorim sacking: Close to ArsenalPep Guardiola has claimed that Manchester United could have been close to Arsenal in the Premier League title race had a handful of results gone their way before the club sacked manager Ruben Amorim.

ISL to start from February 14, all clubs to participate: Sports MinisterSports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya announced on Tuesday that the Indian Super League (ISL), which had been put on hold due to the lack of a commercial partner, will resume from February 14.

Watch: Rohit Sharma continues no vada pav policy, declines fan's offer in MumbaiRohit Sharma has rejected his favourite vada pav once again as he declined the offer from a fan politely while training ahead of the India vs New Zealand ODIs in Mumbai on Tuesday, January 6.

Pant's lack of ODI game time irks Ex-India batter: He is a generational talentFormer cricketer Aakash Chopra has raised concerns about the Indian selectors' handling of wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant in the ODI squad, pointing out the lack of playing opportunities for Pant since 2024 despite his inclusion against New Zealand.

Pretty s**t stat: Travis Head turns press room into comedy club in SydneyAshes 2025-26: Travis Head lit up the SCG with a breathtaking century and then carried the entertainment into the press room, delighting journalists with humour, honesty and effortless charm after another Ashes masterclass.

India has a doping problem: Full list of athletes who tested positive in 2025India has a doping problem. Several athletes across disciplines were suspended after testing positive for banned substances last year. Here's the full list.

Sri Lanka vs Pakistan T20I series Live Streaming: Squads and all you need to knowThe Sri Lanka–Pakistan T20I series in Dambulla from January 7–11 serves as a key World Cup 2026 warm-up, allowing both teams to test combinations, assess depth and fine-tune strategies in familiar conditions.

Brendon McCullum may quit as coach if England give post-Ashes ultimatum: ReportBrendon McCullum may reportedly quit as the coach of the England and Wales cricket board gives him an ultimatum to make sweeping changes to the team's environment and culture. The ECB review has started on England's poor Ashes series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
